name: Italian Biscotti
author: Bernie
summary: A traditional biscotti recipe. Great for dunking in coffee or tea.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F ( 165 degrees C )
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar together
Add eggs one at a time; beat until fluffy
Stir in the anise and vanilla extracts
Sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt; Add them to the egg mixture along with the chopped almonds
Stir with a spoon and as the dough comes together, Knead by hand
Roll each piece into a log about 15 inches long
Place logs onto cookie sheets, 2 to a sheet, the long way
Flatten the logs out until they are about 3 inches wide with a slight hump going down the middle
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, loaves should be firm
Cut the loaves into diagonal slices 1/2 inch wide, place the slices onto the cookie sheets and return to the oven
Toast on one side, then turn them over to do the other side
This will take about 7 to 10 minutes
